definition: variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
total defeat of an army (idiom); fig. a complete wipeout

sentences.english: Within a short while the 13th Army Group was completely wiped out, with all its troops surrendered.
sentences.chinese: 第十三兵團隨即全軍覆沒，所屬部隊全部投降。

sentences.english: That formidable remnant had been annihilated; the Guard was dead.
sentences.chinese: 那點銳不可當的殘餘也被殲滅了，羽林軍覆沒了。

sentences.english: Stormy weather, JAC Yantie transit so that, unfortunately, Guan Chuan ditch was lost in the Han River.
sentences.chinese: 狂風暴雨之中，江淮鹽鐵轉運使官船不幸在邗溝覆沒。

sentences.english: In the Majiang Battle between China and France, Chinese Fujian Sea Fleet was almost annihilated.
sentences.chinese: 在中法馬江之戰中，中國的福建艦隊幾乎全軍覆沒。

sentences.english: "Even though he might've known they were going to be massacred, " amended Puller.
sentences.chinese: “即使他知道他們可能全軍覆沒，”普勒修正到。

sentences.english: The whole army went down in flames, and no one survived.
sentences.chinese: 那支部隊全軍覆沒，無一生還。

sentences.english: All three enemy warships were sunk.
Instead, it lifted the big boats but tended to sink or swamp many smaller ones.
sentences.chinese: 相反，它托起了大船，卻淹沒或覆沒了衆多小船。

sentences.english: The Necromancers are utterly destroyed in the War of the Broken Staff.
sentences.chinese: 在斷杖之役中，亡靈巫師們全軍覆沒了。

sentences.english: Crushed between two armies, the remaining Dark Iron forces were utterly destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 剩餘的黑鐵部族部隊被兩面夾擊，全軍覆沒。
